meanings.definition: To work, write, or study laboriously, especially late at night.
meanings.sent1: She lucubrated on her thesis until the early hours of the morning.
meanings.sent2: The author lucubrated over his novel to ensure every detail was perfect.
meanings.sent3: After lucubrating for hours, she finally finished her research paper.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to lucubrating on the project shone through in the final presentation.
meanings.sent5: The student lucubrated diligently to prepare for the exam.

meanings.definition: Elaborately produced or polished, as a literary work.
meanings.sent1: The lucubrated manuscript was a masterpiece of intricate detail.
meanings.sent2: Her lucubrated poem was praised for its elegant language and structure.
meanings.sent3: The artist's lucubrated painting captivated all who saw it.
meanings.sent4: The lucubrated prose of the novel transported readers to another world.
meanings.sent5: The lucubrated play was a work of art that left the audience in awe.
